issues.title: Build for 17.10
issues.body: Would be awesome if we can use this in 17.10 please

issue_comments.body: Thanks i'll give it a try

issues.title: Select window on hover
issues.body:
I would like windows to be selected on hover rather than on click, making it easier to find the window I want.

This would serve a similar purpose to opacify I think, but it would work without compiz and be more what I want anyway.

commits.message:
Better behavior for Desktop Actions

Launch "quicklist" (Desktop Action) Execs them the same way we launch
normal Execs.  Makes it so Firefox's "New Window" action doesn't open
http://www.%u.com/.  I am sure this solves similar issues with other
software too.

I preserved API backwards compatibility, but it may be sensible to
refactor this.

Don't use the full command line as an identifier

Variation on 26570a7 as explained.  Unknown effects on behavior.

Only fallback to cmd identifier when needed

Using the cmd identifier is quite problematic.  If it contains null
bytes, it will result in an error farther down the line, causing the
group not to be shown!  This change makes cmd act in the same way as the
window title, in that res_class and res_name are preferred.

It is probably wise to split cmd by null bytes and choose only the first
one, but since I am unsure of all the potential ramifications of such a
change (would it be better to replace null bytes with spaces?) and
because this change fixes the problem for me, I will not include that in
this commit.

issue_comments.body:
I was thinking more like [this](https://github.com/benburrill/dockbarx/tree/hoverselect).  However there are some problems with it.  The `reorder_window_list` gconf setting needs to be disabled for it to be even slightly useful, and then you have to change the left mouse click action so that when you click on it it doesn't minimize the window.  There are a few problems with focus too which I didn't bother with.  

I also left the delay super long in that commit for testing purposes.

issues.title: Switching to app shouldn't open minimized windows
issues.body:
If I have some windows minimized for a certain app and I switch to it by clicking its icon in the dock, all minimized windows get un-minimized and open with the other ones.

Minimized windows should stay minimized/be ignored when one switches apps.

issue_comments.body:
I would think the use case in any time you have a software where you work on multiple files at the same time but only one at once. For instance, I use windows heavily to group browser tabs while programming, minimize the ones I don't need at the moment, and switch back and forth between the HTML editor and the browser window I need. Then during break I open my "tabs group" with personal sites like Reddit and HN, etc. etc.

I think the default should be that minimized windows stay minimized, since that's what the user is attempting to do: keep some windows minimized.

issues.title: Offset in Window Previews
issues.body:
I'm running Arch Linux with Xfce as my desktop manager and Compiz as my window manager. When I'm using the Xfce dockbarx applet or Dockx, the window previews for un-maximized windows is shifted:
![screenshot_2017-11-22_19-50-49](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25344287/33132317-5f8968b8-cfbf-11e7-8fa3-65ff92a01c85.png)

This does not occur with maximized windows:
![screenshot_2017-11-22_19-53-00](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25344287/33132325-689b9dfe-cfbf-11e7-86ad-634d33dce658.png)

This happens with both the Xfce dockbarx plugin and Docx.

issues.title: Random occurence Render problem in xfce4 after wake up from sleep
issues.body:
In random occurence after wake from suspend, dockx doesn't render it self properly. it doesn't render the dock background and icon. but an icon will show up if the cursor hover above the coresponding icon.

dockx is standalone
ubuntu 16.04 using official ppa
xfce4.12 xubuntu
using 2 monitor and  2 dockx

issue_comments.body: Or if you put it in "panel 0", it will works with "Blend with panel"

you must be fast! :wink: 
maybe it's [xfce-plugin](https://github.com/TiZ-EX1/xfce4-dockbarx-plugin/) issues. It doesn't happen if dockx not used in panel.

try with `--monitor 1` for your extended monitor
and `--monitor 0` or without any flags for your primary monitor

you should not run it from terminal after log in because dockx will be the child of the terminal. so if terminal was closed, so do the dock.
make use a startup script instead. put `dockx --monitor 0 &; sleep 5; dockx --monitor 1;` in your script.

it happen if dockx initializing with Dock Type others than panel and if behaviour other than panel or standar, with a windows behind, or no need windows behind if behaviour is autohide. looks like the dockx was not yet finish it's initializing or there's something wrong with it's initialization then go hidden before it's done.

![dockxbug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8869999/32787464-29213bd4-c989-11e7-8f4f-d9ceff81023a.png)
it's looked like that on left side. note that only icon that was hovered/passed with cursor will appears. it's edited by the way, and the normal one should looked like the right side (4 icon on the right). the picture use plank background, but when the problem happens, any background theme will do (not rendered, like left side).

issues.title: Hide certain applications
issues.body: I'm using dockbarx with XFCE, and it'd be nice to be able to hide certain applications from dockbarx.  As far as I know, there's not currently a way to do this.  Sorry if this feature already exists, or if it's outside the projects scope.

issues.title: Problems with "Ignore windows on other workspaces"
issues.body:
Hey, I am recently checking out dockbarx and really like it so far. I typically hide windows of other workspaces in my taskbar and was happy to see such an option in dockbarx.

Unfortunately I encountered some errors using this option. Selecting applications from a different workspace is still possible using the `<Super>-<Tab>` keyboard combination and behaves strangely. Sometimes the application is moved to the current workspace, sometimes a new instance is launched. Using `<Super>-<Number>` has similar issues for me.

The attached screenshot shows the selecting of _hidden_ windows using `<Super>-<Tab>`.

I am using the version provided in the ppa for Wily:

```
> dockx --version
DockbarX 0.92
```

![screenshot_2016-06-14_20-02-50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/328798/16053905/070f42b8-326b-11e6-8a98-bebd5514cca4.png)

issue_comments.body: Bump, I am playing around with a dual screen setup and cannot move Dockbarx to my primary monitor.

issues.title: Minimize Animation Glitch (Issue)
issues.body:
In XFCE if you have (for example) Compiz Reloaded running to enable animations and you open an application that isn't already on the panel-dock, then minimize an application that was already open before you opened the new app, the minimize animations happens to the location of the app before the extra one was opened.

A clearer example of this is if I have Firefox open and then open up a new application that isn't pinned and then I go back to minimize Firefox, it doesn't minimize directly into the icon, it minimises to where the icon used to be.

If this could be fixed I would very much appreciate that!

issues.title: Dock Applets don't work
issues.body:
Dock Applets don't work at all. Tested in Ubuntu 16.04 and 14.04 with both the latest DockBarX 0.92 and 0.91.4. 

All the applets I enable are reset when I close and reopen the DOckBarX preferences. There's no terminal output to indicate anything related to this.

issue_comments.body: Indeed, there's a fixed Cardapio available in the main WebUpd8 PPA. See step 5 from here: http://www.webupd8.org/2014/04/how-to-install-and-tweak-gnome.html
The official DockBarX PPA wasn't updated for Xenial because the app didn't work in Xenial :) I'll update it soon.

Well, this is weird. I got them to work. Basically, after some dock applets are enabled, you need to click the "refresh" button in the middle of the DockBarX Dock Applets preferences window or else they are not saved:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/325449/14811137/462209b0-0b9f-11e6-9eb2-b7639e0e2b91.png)

By the way, only the AppIndicator applet seems to work.
Done, PPA updated (includes the Xfce panel plugin).
Not only the WebUpd8 repository but also the DockBarX repo ;)
I maintain the DockBarX PPA, but I can't create a new PPA for the Dockbar-main group, @M7S needs to create it. If he does, I'll try to package the GTK3 branch when I have some free time.

issues.title: Mate Applet
issues.body:
I'd like to assist in getting dockbarx working in mate again.  Currently I use dockx and a bastardized toolbar setup so that they are kind of integrated. However I would really love for applet panel to work again and clean everything up.  If someone understands where the issue is and point me in a good direction to start I'd love to take a crack at fixing it.  From what I gather it has something to do with mate dropping the python applet api so the next question would be would it be easier to reimplement the python api in mate or modify dockbarx to work with whatever system mate is using now.

Thanks

I'd like to see a standalone mechanism to generate previews so that it becomes standard behavior for every DockBarX install. A lot of people probably don't realize the feature exists because enabling it is not straightforward.
@aikeru what distro and version of Linux are you using?

issues.title: Redesign of the preferences dialog
issues.body:
# Redesign of the preferences dialog

The preferences dialog of DockbarX has been around for a while and gone through quite a few changes. While DockbarX has gotten more and more features the preferences dialog has become more and more crowded with options, to the point where the dialog can feel quite intimidating to new users. It is perhaps time to rewrite it from scratch to make it easier to understand. Now I need **your** help to get it done.
### Mock ups

Send mock ups of how you would like the preference dialog to be rearranged to be easier to use and understand. Let your creativity flow freely as long as you remember that the key focus is on making something that is _easier to use_.
### Language

English isn't my native language and I have a bit of a  fondness for playing with words which doesn't always help when you need to write short informative sentences. Help me improve the wording in the texts to make the language more clear. This will help not only the end user, but also the translators who will have an easier job of translating when they don't have to start by guessing what the original text really means.
### Opinions

Even if you can't make mock ups or don't speak English well enough to improve the language you can share your opinions of what things in the dialog you find most confusing and what you think should be changed.

Below are screenshots of how DockbarX preferences dialog looks like right now in untranslated English. Some options (regrettably far from all of them) have tooltips. Sadly they don't show up on screenshots.  
![dbx preference page 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467464/3016e8de-0291-11e4-80a9-fb4c3ac4ab88.png)
![dbx preference page 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467465/3017493c-0291-11e4-8d93-7c9d21e7c89c.png)
![dbx preference page 3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467466/3018f9b2-0291-11e4-933f-90ef3d77f6ac.png)
![dbx preference page 4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467467/3019626c-0291-11e4-9493-ab88dfe30451.png)
![dbx preference page 5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467468/301c2740-0291-11e4-98a1-c5d5512efadf.png)
![dbx preference page 6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467469/301c6764-0291-11e4-8b97-903b251bb220.png)
![dbx preference page 7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467471/302ea668-0291-11e4-9b40-98fb609ed3b4.png)
![dbx preference page 8](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467470/302eac9e-0291-11e4-8682-442acb0aabd3.png)
The AWN tab screenshot is missing since it only shows up if AWN is running and right now I'm not on a computer with AWN installed. I'll add it to the issue later.

commits.message:
Merge pull request #55 from benburrill/fix-desktop-actions

Better behavior for Desktop Actions

Merge pull request #54 from benburrill/fix-id

Fix identifier choice when no name is immediately present

Merge pull request #53 from xuzhen/master

fix the visibility bugs of arrow buttons
- Fixed bug #38: dockbarx as a panel applet in gnome 2 was broken.

Merge pull request #52 from luigi1809/master

Improved button group identifier reading - support for wine apps and no name windows

Merge pull request #37 from DanielPower/master

Fixed tooltips on windows that had not yet been opened.

Merge pull request #44 from Lesik/patch-1

Remove misused "Version" key from desktop file

Merge pull request #43 from gsantner/master

Replace outdated Unity quicklist with FreeDesktop Standard Actions #40

Merge pull request #47 from salphaon/master

Fixed unminimize error in groupbutton
Brought up version number to 0.92 and updated CHANGELOG

- DockbarX can now update the window list so that the last used window always is first in the list. (This behavior is now used by default but can be changed in preferences.)
- Some code clean up.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:M7S/dockbarx

Merge pull request #11 from Erudition/patch-1

inserted missing word

Merge pull request #10 from xuzhen/master

fix crash at startup and issue 5
- Added class name fix for xbmc.bin.
Changed calls to the deprecated PIL function .tostring to .tobytes.

Added a script for making translation templates and updated the
translation template.

Added a Contribute section to README.md
Removed README. README.md is readable enough.
Updated README.md
Updated README.md
Brought up version number to 0.91.4 and updated changelog

Fix for issue 4:
DockbarX freezed when minimizing applications if certain themes
were used.
Merge branch 'hotfix-0.91.3'
Brought up version number to 0.91.3 and updated CHANGELOG
Fixed bug that broke DockX in 0.91.2
Updated CHANGELOG
Merge branch 'fix-reload' into hotfix-0.91.2
Correcting a previous commit. AWN applet's reload should not use tell_parent=False.
Brought up version number to 0.91.2
Merge branch 'fix-reload' into develop
Fixed wrongly written comment.

DockbarX wasn't readded after reload. That should be fixed now.
Parent applets should have a function readd_container that dockbar
can call.
Merge branch 'hotfix-0.91.1'
Bumped version number to 0.91.1
Fixed Bug #1331820 (lp): DockX showed arrows instead of adjusting its width or height.
Updated README.md and README, small changes.
Updated README.md and README, small problems.
Added README.md
Updated README and added markdown.
Added .gitignore

Version 0.91
- Bug #1316501 and #1329240: Xfce4-terminal was unpinable and had the wrong icon in Xubuntu.
- Fixed small bug regarding handling of groups without a desktopentry.
- README and CHANGELOG updated.
- Fixed a bug that broke certain menu options (like unpin application) if zeitgeist was not installed. Last commit reverted and a new fix is done.
- Fixed a bug that broke certain menu options (like unpin application) if zeitgeist was not installed.
- DockbarX now checks for gnome-desktop-item-edit or exo-desktop-item edit and uses the one installed when editing launchers instead of just assuming that gnome-desktop-item-edit is installed.

- Improved code separation: everything specific to gnomeapplet is moved out of dockbar.py and into dockbar_factory. The dockbar class is also not acting differently depending on if it is runned in dockx, awn or gnome panel, instead it needs to be instructed by the calling class on how to act.
- The awn applet has been broken since size overflow management was introduced. It works again now (but it can't still manage size overflow).

- Improved code separation: everything specific to gnomeapplet is moved out of dockbar.py and into dockbar_factory. The dockbar class is also not acting differently depending on if it is runned in dockx, awn or gnome panel, instead it needs to be instructed by the calling class on how to act.
- The awn applet has been broken since size overflow management was introduced. It works again now (but it can't still manage size overflow).
- Made battery applet work with UPower 0.99 and later.
- Fixed a bug that filled up the log with source ID warnings.
- The battery applet added some empty space underneat it when the dock was reloaded (only on vertical docks). Fixed.

- The dock behaves in a more sane way when a namebar, window title or two spacer applets are used (it looks like it did before the size overflow feature were added.
- Some code clean up in dockx file.
- Added some possible paths for the appindicator-service bin. The appindicator applet should start the service correctly for Ubuntu 14.04 now.
- Made dockbarx expand when used as a gnome applet since dockbarx can't handle situations when the icons overflow the screen space otherwise.

- Removed some ugly CairoSurface to gkd.Pixbuf transformations by using PIL instead of pixbufs in a couple of functions. Could possibly speed up DockbarX ever so slightly or reduce memory foot print by a small amount (since cstringIO is no longer imported).

- Changed all python files to execute /usr/bin/python2 instead of /usr/bin/python.
- Bug #1314868: Random junkpixels were shown around icons in some themes when a newer version of the library pillow (or PIL?) was used. Fixed.

- Bug #652386 and Bug #1120940: DockbarX do anything - or worse since a few versions back it froze - when too many windows of a program was opened so that the window list didn't fit the screen. Now the window list gets a scrollbar instead when it would become too big to fit the screen.
- Bug #1272106: Pillow is replacing imaging. A quick fix for gentoo (and other?) users.

- DockbarX can now handle situations where there are more groupbuttons than can fit on the screen.
- Small code cleanups and some comments added.

- Added Battery Status applet.
- Fixed a small bug in Appindicator applet.
- Appindicators now store previously used icons in cache to prevent slowdowns (or even freezes of the whole dock) when a appinicator quickly changes icons frequently to animate the indicator.
- Last commit broke appindicator menus. Fixed.

- Zeitgeist dbus calls are done async.
- Locked window list is now called floating window panel instead. Hopefully that makes more sense.
- Code cleanup in menu related and zeitgeist code.

- Made some (perhaps that last) synced dbus calls asynced.
- Small code cleanups.
- Fixed two small appindicator applet (and gtk style menu) bugs.
- (Possible) fix for bug #865836: windows doesn't disappear from the list on multi monitor setups.
Bug #1071063: Changes in DockbarX 0.90 had broken DockbarX AWN applet.

- Bug #1070441: Application indicators didn't work for ubuntu 11.04 (still doesn't for ubuntu 10.4). I also removed some arguments from dbus command Watch since they shouldn't be there in the first place and caused error messages in 11.04.
- changed default behaviour for namebar from showing only for maximized windows to always show.

Version 0.90.3
- Updated version numbers and CHANGELOG.

- Added volume-control applet to setup.py so it gets installed.
- Fixed a bug that stopped volume-control from starting.

Version 0.90.2
- CHANGELOG and version numbers updated.
- Appindicator applet is updated to support older versions of application-indicator-service (used in ubuntu 11.10).
- Appindicator applet updated so that it can start indicator-application-service in ubuntu 12.10. The file was moved to another directory in this version.

Version 0.90.1
- README, CHANGELOG and version numbers are updated.
- Translations are updated.
- Added launcher for DockX.

- Small change to where appindicator menu pops up.
- App indicator icon size is set to 18 instead of 16.

- Appindicator menus no longer pop up at mouse pointer location but next to the dock, more like they do in unity.
- Fixed a little visual glitch caused by the last bug fix.
- Removed some left over print statements from the code.
- Fix for Bug #970737: DockX background disappears on mouse over with cairo 1.12
- Fixed bug #1066875: Visual glitches in right click menu for ubuntu 12.10 (compiz bug).
- The default theme is now for real Glassified. Forgot to change that earlier.
- A little (possible) bugfix perhaps related to Bug #1066875.
- Changed setup so that namebar themes are installed in the right folder.

Version 0.90
- README, CHANGELOG and version numbers updated.
- Translation template updated.
- Clock appet fixed so that its preferences dialog works again.

- Theme making: rotation can be applied directly when using composite command by setting the option angle. The rotate command has also gotten a new option: resize. If it is set to True the pixmap will be resized so that the whole rotated image is visible instead of cuting of the corners of the image.
- Theme making: To make it easier to make themes that works up, down, left and right sets are added. A set lets you define different values for left, right, up and down that can be used in xoffets, yoffsets and angles by writing the offset name instead of a number.
- Dock theme making: If strech_bg_img is set to 1 the dock theme background image will be streched to the height of the dock for horizontal docks or to the width of the dock for vertical docks.
- Glass DMD is updated to look more correct when used verticallly.
- DBX Preferences behaves more correctly if it can't find the theme it should use.
- Changed some theme infos.
- Changed theme DockXYZ so that it scales down to small sizes better.

- The themes can be set to behave differently depending on orienteation (left, right, up, down).
- Images used in themes can be rotated now (for now it works best with square images).
- Sizes in themes can be set in both percentage and pixels (or a combination of both.
- All bundled themes are updated to work on vertical docks and panels. DockXYZ and Colors behaves differently depending on which side of the screen they are on as well.

- New themes, popup styles and dock themes are added. Old ones are removed.
- The appearence tab of dockbarx preferences is changed visually to be easier to use.
- A small bug making preferences crash when a theme can't be found is fixed.
- Two bugs in appindictaor applet are fixed.

- Mediaplayer buttons (in the window list) are now using async dbus calls. Slowstarters like spotify should no longer freeze DockbarX for a few seconds.
- Two small spotify dbus bugs worked around.
- Removed the non-ASCII char from my name in the copyright notice of the volume control applet. (I really must stop doing that kind of small but breaking changes just before committing. Sorry.)

- A volume applet is added (ported from awn).
- Appindicator works on vertical docks now.
- Update command added to Applets. It the method is called when the dock changes.
- Fixed a bug in appindicator applet that stopped icon and label changes.
- Forgot to update setup.py. Fixed.

- Added an AppIndicator applet.
- Fixed a small dbus signal removing bug in dbusmenu used by unity quicklists and appindicators.
- The last change to the applet system broke the applet preference dialog (for now only used by clock applet). This is fixed now.
- Forgot to update setup.py.

- Changed the applet system. An applet concists of a .applet and a .py file now. This change was made so that DockbarX doesn't have to load every applet just to check their name. Now it only loads those applets that are shown.
- Added the namebar themes.

- DockX applets can now be placed in the middle of the dock as well as in both ends (there are two spacer applets in the list now).
- Namebar makes a reapperance as a DockX applet. It is also split up in two separate applets, Window title and Window buttons to allow for more flexibility.
- Applets can now be expandable (replace a spacer applet). Namebar uses this feature.
- DockbarX themes can now have a info file in them that explains how the theme is intended to be used and gives suggestions on color options and so on. The text of this file is shown when pressing the new info button that is shown next to the theme name in the preferences. All themes that are shipped with dockbarx or the theme pack should have a info text starting from the next release.
- Fixed a bug in cardapio applet that caused the dock to crash on reloads.

- The standalone dock now supports applets.
- A clock applet is added. Besides setting color and font it also supports gnome-panel custom clock stings to set custom looks. Clicking it opens orage calendar if installed but behavior can be changed by editing the gconf key /apps/dockbarx/applets/coommand.
- A cardapio launcher button. Requires cardapio to work.

issue_comments.body: There is a menu applet. You can use cardapio within DockX, if you have cardapio installed.

I think Webupd8 has cardapio in its ppa. It is quite well functioning even though it's not maintained.

## 

Sent from my Android device with K-9 Mail. Please excuse my brevity.

Thanks for reporting. 
There's small bug that causes an error in that snippet. If that's the whole problem it is easily fixed. I pushed the fix to the branch hotfix-0.91.4 so you can try it or if you installed through ppa or some other packaging system and don't want to install dockbarx manually, you could simply edit `/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/dockbarx/iconfactory.py` and add these two line before line 715.

``` python
            w = surface.get_width()
            h = surface.get_height()
```

That's the whole fix. Please tell me if it works so that I know if I should make a new release containing this fix. (The bug is related to the theme you are using so please try it with the same theme as before.)

Great. I'll make a new release tomorrow.

## 

Sent from my Android device with K-9 Mail. Please excuse my brevity.
I can confirm the bug and will look into it.

Thank you very much for those mock ups! They look like clear improvements over the current state. I will look at them more closely in a couple of weeks (after my wedding and honey moon) but right now the only bigger problem I see is that there doesn't seem to be any clear way to change the order of the applets?
xuzhen fix is used.
New release is made. Sorry for being such a lazy developer.
This feature would require quite a bit of work. I have no intrest or time in doing so myself but if someone likes to add this feature, I would assist in any way I can.

I haven't made a conscious decision to stop developing DockbarX, even if I have been extremely inactive the last two years. I hope to do a better job in the future.

But porting to PyGObject is quite hard. I got stuck on it so many times two years ago that I gave up (and lost quite a bit of my interest in developing DockbarX, as you can see). So for now I make no promises regarding DockbarX in gnome-panel or mate-panel.

Hi!
That's my branch. It was my latest try. I was working on getting the standalone dock to work with PyGObject (and gtk3) before looking into the gnomeapplet.
If this bug still exists it should be posted to the issue tracker of the xfce-plugin.
This one is fixed, right?

If you have installed anything manually, those files will be used even if you install from a ppa later. Manual installs install in /usr/local/lib while the ppas installs the files in /usr/lib and the former is used over the later.

If you want to use the ppa instead of manual install you need to delete the files that the manual install made. Run the manual install again and see where it puts the files and remove them. Unfortunately there's no uninstall options in the setup system that Dockbarx uses.
You can right click the launcher in DockbarX and choose preferences (or is it properties?) and choose edit launcher and choose a name of your liking.

It has surely been a while. Sorry about that. I will implement something like this but I will see if it is possible to get rid of the gconfsettings and switch to dconf instead before I start with this so that I don't have to do big changes right after the rewrite. I can't giva any time frame for it, too much going on in personal life.
@ainola I know it was ages since you made the mockups but do you have any mocksups for the window actions and selection actions tabs?

From the readme:
**NOTE!** To use previews with Compiz you need to activate KDE Compability in compiz settings manager and under KDE Compability check "Support Plasma Thumbnails". _You can *_not*\* use previews with other window manager than Compiz and Kwin.*
I don't even know where to start with this one and there are more pressing issues, so no updates for now or in a foreseeable future on this one. Sorry.

Sorry for not responing right away. The monitor can be set from commandline:

dockx --monitor 2

Since the gtk3 port is working now and mate is getting support for gtk3 panel applets, I hope to be able to have a mate applet for dockbarx done (or in beta phase) before ubuntu mate 16.10 is released. (It's just my goal, though, not a promise. My private life is pretty busy right now.)

I guess that at least keyboard shortcuts depends on calls to X11. I have to look into this when I've got time.

You are using the regular dockbarx, right? I would be interested in knowing if the same problems exist in the gtk3 branch.
Thanks for the patch. Sorry that I didn't merge it sooner.
The patch in #52 probably fixed this.

I believe it's less productive since the buttons would have to move around to make room for the text. My goal with DockbarX is that if you for example want to interact with Firefox through Dockbarx you should be able to do that from the same few pixels on the screen at all time (as long as Firefox is a pinned application of course.

tl;dr I have no interest in implementing this. Sorry.

I never tried to run Dockbarx on Slackware. I found [your question on LinuxQuestions.org](https://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/slackware-14/slackware64-14-2-xfce-how-to-compile-dockbarx-and-xfce4-dockbarx-plugin-4175608685/) while googling it and assume you got it to work using the recommendations in the answer by bassmadrigal? I put his list here as well if somebody else are wondering about the same thing.

The dependencies for slackware:
> hicolor-icon-theme 									-> 	Included in 14.2 (hicolor-icon-theme)
pygtk 											-> 	Included in 14.2 (pygtk)
python2-dbus										->	Included in 14.2 (dbus-python)
python2-gconf										->	gnome-python2-gconf
python2-keybinder2									->	python-keybinder
python2-numpy (python2-numpy-mkl, python2-numpy-openblas)				->	numpy
python2-pillow										->	Included in 14.2 (python-pillow)
python2-six										->	six
python2-wnck										->	Included in 14.2 (libwnck)
python2-xdg										->	pyxdg
python2-xlib (python2-xlib-svn								->	python-xlib
avant-window-navigator (avant-window-navigator-git) (optional) – AWN DockBarX Plugin	->	avant-window-navigator
cardapio-bzr (optional) – required to run menu applet for dockx (standalone dock)	->	Not currently available on 14.2 or SBo
compiz-fusion-plugins-main (compiz-fusion-plugins-main-git) (optional) – opacify plugin	->	compiz-plugins-main
dockmanager (optional) – dockmanager plugins						->	Not currently available on 14.2 or SBo
xfce4-dockbarx-plugin (xfce4-dockbarx-plugin-git) (optional) – Xfce4 Panel Plugin	->	Not currently available on 14.2 or SBo
zeitgeist (optional) – recently used file list						->	Not currently available on 14.2 or SBo
I guess I have to install compiz again and see if I can duplicate this.

I'm not sure what behavior is better, this or the current one. I could always make that an option. (Since we are drowning in options already one more probably wouldn't be the end of the world.) But what should be the default?

Can you give a use case where this behavior is better?
Sorry for not answering before now. Do you find any error messages in the log when this happens?

Sorry for not answering you until now. 

I'm not sure I understand the need of this. Why do you want to this?

GNOME 2.28? It seems like you renew your system as frequently as I answer bug reports...

Apparently I have managed to break DockbarX as GNOME applet while working on DockX or DockbarX as a AWN applet. I commited fix for this bug. Sorry it took this long for me to look at it.

Oh. I didn't even know it wasn't packaged for 17.10. I wonder if there is any problem with running it on 17.10 that I'm not aware of (still using 16.04) or if @hotice simply (and understandably) thinks DockbarX is dead and has stopped packaging it.

This sounds a bit messy to me since all windows will be brought up and left unordered but I made a branch to test it anyway. Try it and see if does what you want.

https://github.com/M7S/dockbarx/tree/hoverselect

Hello,

Hello,

Cardapio currently is no longer maintained / no longer in development according to:

And the Cardapio PPA has also not been updated for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS "Trusty Tahr" as far as I can see:

So I don't see how the Caradapio applet inside DockX would help me.

Any alternative?

Regards

I have fixed this bug in my fork: https://github.com/xuzhen/dockbarx/commit/73cb0161cdeed82ed396202bb1c2ae6db65cb950
You can modify those files yourself.

If you don't have multiple monitors, you can just simply disable "ignore windows on other monitors" option by using the following command
`gconftool -s /apps/dockbarx/show_only_current_monitor -t bool false`

I also fixed issue #5: https://github.com/xuzhen/dockbarx/commit/b924573747b532972242d4ef566c1cacfbc7b47f
window preview only works on plasma desktop.

Yes, there is no "Pin application", but you can "Make custom launcher".
And it won't trigger the cursor issue.

run the following command to fix this problem
`sudo chown -R $USER:$USER ~/.dockbarx/`

Hi @KabbAmine 
I have commited some patches into my fork to fix that. Please try it.

Are you using the latest code from this repository?
Is there any error messages in terminal?

The code in official PPA is a bit outdated. You should download the newest codes and replace the old ones.
run the following commands in terminal

```
sudo wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/M7S/dockbarx/master/dockbarx/groupbutton.py -O /usr/share/pyshared/dockbarx/groupbutton.py
sudo wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/M7S/dockbarx/master/dockbarx/windowbutton.py -O /usr/share/pyshared/dockbarx/windowbutton.py
```

@JanFrydrych If you are using ubuntu, you can use [this PPA](https://launchpad.net/~xuzhen666/+archive/ubuntu/dockbarx). It contains all the patches after 0.91.4 release. Other debian-based distributions may also be compatible.

The offical PPA has not been updated for a long time, you can try [my PPA](https://launchpad.net/~xuzhen666/+archive/ubuntu/dockbarx) instead.
try my PPA: https://launchpad.net/~xuzhen666/+archive/ubuntu/dockbarx

On Mon, Jun 23, 2014 at 2:14 PM, Matias Särs notifications@github.com
wrote:

> Thanks for reporting.
> There's small bug that causes an error in that snippet. If that's the
> whole problem it is easily fixed. I pushed the fix to the branch
> hotfix-0.91.4 so you can try it or if you installed through ppa or some
> other packaging system and don't want to install dockbarx manually, you
> could simply edit /usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/dockbarx/iconfactory.py
> and add these two line before line 715.
> 
> ```
>         w = surface.get_width()
>         h = surface.get_height()
> ```
> 
> That's the whole fix. Please tell me if it works so that I know if I
> should make a new release containing this fix. (The bug is related to the
> theme you are using so please try it with the same theme as before.)
>

_Michael Chmielewski_\* |\* Practice Lead, Release Engineering

Hi, there! I've made some mockups of a much cleaner design. I love this dock but the settings dialogue has always been a bit daunting. I hope I can be useful!

I made sure every option is still configurable but some are done in a more humanistic way. I got lazy near the end and didn't do the other two tabs for mouse/keyboard and I still haven't done the popup dialogues that are activated with the 'gear' icon. If this is agreeable, the skeleton (and much of the meat) is all there. I changed only a few words around, I figured we could work on the language after the design has been implemented.

Also, I hope that lightswitches is an acceptable widget to use; I'm not sure if you support GTK2 or GTK3. If not GTK3, we can make do without them.

Thanks so much for such an amazing piece of software.  

Some suggestions for the present:

Firstly, right clicking on the bar to configure says 'properties'. Properties is a word defining an object and gives no indication to configure the dockbar. 'Configure' or 'Customize' would be better terminology. 

Secondly, the configuration window should not have a 'close' button: that's what the x is for at the top-right of your window!

How liberal shall I be on filing bug reports/pull requests?
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5383525/3576670/b30143b4-0b94-11e4-92fb-32fde00a2faf.png)
![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5383525/3576667/b3006174-0b94-11e4-8823-b61645068767.png)
![3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5383525/3576669/b3011510-0b94-11e4-9f6b-f05779d5ff5a.png)
![4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5383525/3576668/b300fda0-0b94-11e4-892b-761d573c2d3a.png)
![5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5383525/3576671/b33fc6a2-0b94-11e4-9a56-9c568d6930bc.png)
![6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5383525/3576666/b300678c-0b94-11e4-9087-7f9d92187ad4.png)

On my singling of themes in the 'appearance' pane, my rationale is thusly: User can select from available themes with the single drop-down menu. If the user has any desires to mix-and-match components or change colors, s/he may then open the configuration prompt (adjacent cog) and adjust to desires. If the user does customize the theme like this, then the main drop-down menu will display Custom. Also, on the subject of the 'Needs attention effect' - the water ripples should only be presented to the user if Compiz is installed on the system. And as for keyboard shortcuts/Mouse bindings, it is more useful to be able to click a button and map the configuration like in Gnome's keyboard binding settings or Compiz's settings manager. As you might have noted, the window itself does not need to be as tall as my mockups - I had just left extra space in case I needed expansion. If anything is not clear, please do speak up.

Happy wedding! Congratulations :thumbsup: 

Curses! I had no idea that the applets were ordered in that dialogue... I had assumed that it was graphically managed via the dock. If you're still wanting to keep that in the preferences, I imagine the proper way would be to have re-orderable checkbox items somewhat like the current layout.... but without the cumbersome left/right arrows to disable/enable.
@docphees, nah, that seems to be a legitimate bug.
It's been a while, @M7S. Any plans to implement something like this?

@M7S It's been a while. :)

First, I think it would be best to know how involved you want to get with the GTK widgets. I'm assuming you plan on using GTK3? I also think proper mockups might be in order rather than the slap-job I did long ago. What I did may be a decent start but it could be better solidified.
Thanks, I'll wait for a fix.
@xuzhen I'm already using your fork, and it works well.

I'm still using your fork on my xubuntu, and its working as it should.
But now that I have a 2nd monitor, it will be more than great to have the option `show_only_current_monitor` working as expected. Is there any way to implement that in your fork?

Just awesome @xuzhen The multi-monitor option works well.

@JanFrydrych Just download [Xuzhen's fork](https://github.com/xuzhen/dockbarx) and follow the [instructions of a manual installation](https://github.com/xuzhen/dockbarx#manual-installation).

Yeah, better to uninstall it before.

> Isn't Dockbarx developed any more?

Maybe, the last commit in the official repository was done a few months ago.
Use and follow the fork above, it works as expected and Xuzhen usually answers quickly.
I'm mistake window.   sorry

Aha, I did get it working. Thank you.

For anyone who stumbles upon this later, it was as easy as setting the command to the path of the file, so for me it was just:

```
~/.wine/drive_c/"Program Files (x86)"/foobar2000/foobar2000.exe
```

This solved it for me:
http://askubuntu.com/questions/17290/window-preview-is-not-working-in-dockbarx

Having the same problem here. I'm wondering if it could be possible to redo that part of the code without using that pesky python-gnomeapplet. As far as I have messed with this, I would need to download linux mint 14 to be able to use this. what a disappointment! Every time we get some new version of anything, compatibility is lost forever! what a shame!
EDIT
According to this
https://tracker.debian.org/news/368846
Changes:
gnome-python-desktop (2.32.0-4) unstable; urgency=low
.

```
Drop python-gnomeapplet. It has been replaced by gir1.2-panelapplet-4.0 and PyGObject. Closes: #638135
```

Now who knows if switching from python-gnomeapplet to PyGObject won't break DockBarX!

Wondering the same here. By what I remember, the last error I got said that python-gnomeapplet required python version < 2.7 and that my Linux mint mate 17.3 had 2.7.5 installed or something like that.  I'm wondering if it could be possible to redo that part of the code without using that pesky python-gnomeapplet. If that's not possible, I wonder if it would be possible to update the python-gnomeapplet package to work with python  2.7.5. 
What a disappointment! Every time we get some new version of anything, compatibility is lost forever! what a shame!

Thinking the same thing. I wanted to use dockbarx with linux mint mate and compiz anyways.

Hey @M7S ! Glad to hear from you! 
How about this? https://github.com/M7S/dockbarx/tree/pygi-migration it seems someone has already worked on a PyGObject branch for your project. 

Even though I am a programmer, I don't have much experience withy Python, and since I mostly program for windows and for web there are things I don't understand. 

I have downloaded the code from that branch and compared it with the main project and it seems to have been completely ported but I think the panel dockbarx_factory file still relies on python-gnomeapplet because it has a line that says "import gnomeapplet". I have also followed @kq01526 's hint and installed that MATE dock-applet, which does work, but not quite as I expected, It simply adds  application grouped buttons to the panel instead of replacing the current buttons with application grouped ones... now I have two buttons ... pff... 
I have checked that applet code and even though it's coded in python too, it is very different from your code... _SIGH_ 

Long short story, I would like to help but there's still much I must learn about the linux system, specially the MATE desktop for which I want this to work.

```

`dockx` without any flags does give me one dock, and XFCE plugin works, but only in a single panel.

This might be an xfce4 plugin issue rather than DockbarX's

https://github.com/TiZ-EX1/xfce4-dockbarx-plugin/issues/26

I was having the same issue then found some quick workaround above: Do not tick "Blend with panel", select "Solid Color" instead.
Same bug here.

Solid color work well but I don't want to care about panel color. XFCE auto set this. But it's solved. Before set dockbarx in panel zero, installing last version, blend function working now. Thank you guys.
Yes, I still use GNOME2 cause by GNOME3 is unusable, and Unity DE isn't available in my Linux distribution. Thank you for a fix! I'll test in few days...
